content:
Hi everyone :)

my name is Julien Faixo, a french guy passionated with development since I turned 11 (and solution architect in a european IT services company by day since soon 10 years, time flies...). I have really enjoyed discovering Rust by practicing on small use cases or competitive programming problems, and see in it a lot of potential.

I would like to help actively, but I don't know exactly where to start (is there any subject that are more lacking manpower than others ?).
I'll try to find my way in zulip, maybe there are already materials on this subjects (but this is my first zulip time, be nice !)

Have an excellent day,
Julien
There are some issues labelled as E-mentor (also E-easy and friends), these might be a place to start: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-mentor

rust-analyzer isn't in that repo, but it also has some marked as such: https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AE-has-instructions, https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22
Ok, thanks, i'll look into these lists and go for it :)

is there any subject that are more lacking manpower than others

You could just pick one you care about more. I suspect that every team or working group will say that they could use help (and it's likely true).
